net.sf.jga.util
Class UniqueIterator<T>

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.jga.algorithms.Unique.UniqueIterator<T>
      net.sf.jga.util.UniqueIterator<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<T>, java.util.Iterator<T>
Deprecated. moved to within Unique class: use Unique.UniqueIterator 

public class UniqueIterator<T>
extends Unique.UniqueIterator<T>
implements java.lang.Iterable<T>

Iterator that will not return the same element twice in succession. Note -- in addition to this class being deprecated in order to be moved, its implementation of Iterable is also deprecated: the successor class will not implement Iterable.

Copyright © 2003-2005 David A. Hall

Constructor Summary
UniqueIterator(java.util.Iterator<? extends T> base)
          Deprecated. Builds a UniqueIterator for the given base iterator, using a test based on the equals() method of type T.

          Deprecated. Builds a UniqueIterator for the given base iterator that uses the given predicate to compare adjacent elements.
UniqueIterator(java.util.Iterator<? extends T> base, java.util.Comparator<? super T> comp)
          Deprecated. Builds a UniqueIterator for the given base iterator that uses the given comparator to compare adjacent elements

UniqueIterator

public UniqueIterator(java.util.Iterator<? extends T> base,
                      BinaryFunctor<T,T,java.lang.Boolean> eq)
Deprecated. 
Builds a UniqueIterator for the given base iterator that uses the given predicate to compare adjacent elements. The predicate should return true if the adjacent elements are the same.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either argument is null
